page.title: 06HOUSING TYPES - BARGOED AREA
page.content: Over 50% houses in the Bargoed area are of the older terraced type - and of the semi-detached properties most of these are of the same type as the terraced homes already mentioned. Of council owned properties there has been much recent new building of flats and bungalows for OAP's. Also the council have tried to upgrade the standard of its properties, as far as its budget has allowed. The sector with the highest percentage of homes lacking the two basic amenities (fixed bath/shower and inside W.C.) was that of private rented accomodation, whilst council owned properties were the most likely to possess them. 99% of council owned homes possess the two basic amenities, but only 69% of private rented and 88% of owner occupied. The substandard housing in the area can only be remedied by Central Govt. aid.
